\documentclass{article}
\usepackage[T1]{fontenc}
\usepackage{a4wide}

\makeatletter


%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%% LyX specific LaTeX commands.
\newcommand{\LyX}{L\kern-.1667em\lower.25em\hbox{Y}\kern-.125emX\spacefactor1000}

%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%% Textclass specific LaTeX commands.
\newenvironment{lyxlist}[1]
  {\begin{list}{}
    {\settowidth{\labelwidth}{#1}
     \setlength{\leftmargin}{\labelwidth}
     \addtolength{\leftmargin}{\labelsep}
     \renewcommand{\makelabel}[1]{##1 \hfill}}}
  {\end{list}}

\makeatother

\begin{document}

\begin{lyxlist}{00.00.0000}
\item [\textbf{Consequences:}]Entry will only take place manually
\item [\textbf{Response}]\textbf{to failure:}
\end{lyxlist}
The door will open with a manual key and an alarm will go off. If the person
entering is genuine, they will know how to override the alarm. If it is a break-in
then the alarm will act as a signal for help.

\begin{lyxlist}{00.00.0000}
\item [\textbf{Fault:}]The unit is physicaly cut off from the PC
\end{lyxlist}
\textbf{Reported by:}

\begin{lyxlist}{00.00.0000}
\item [\textbf{Likelihood:}]low
\item [\textbf{Consequences:}]The system would not be able to work as an automated
entrance.
\item [\textbf{Response}]\textbf{to failure:}
\end{lyxlist}
Make the connection phisically secure so that this situation could not arise.

\begin{lyxlist}{00.00.0000}
\item [\textbf{Threat:}]A secondary computer connected to the door
\end{lyxlist}
\textbf{Reported by:}

\begin{lyxlist}{00.00.0000}
\item [\textbf{Likelihood:}]low
\item [\textbf{Consequences:}]The new user may allow anautherized access
\item [\textbf{Response}]\textbf{to failure:}
\end{lyxlist}
Either make the connection between the Computer and the door physically tamper
proof or allow the commputer to unit to contain a password only th host computer
would know.

\begin{lyxlist}{00.00.0000}
\item [\textbf{Threat:}]Someone finding a Dallas key
\end{lyxlist}
\textbf{Reported by:}

\begin{lyxlist}{00.00.0000}
\item [\textbf{Likelihood:}]moderate, if the system is running in am enviroment where
a lot of people require keys.
\item [\textbf{Consequences:}]Should not cause any harm to the system
\item [\textbf{Response}]\textbf{to failure:}
\end{lyxlist}
The backup system of also requiring a pin number should prevent people from
accessing the site.

\end{document}
